intro: Hedysarum malacophyllum, commonly known as the purple vetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It has a deep taproot system, allowing it to thrive in arid conditions, and its seeds are adapted for dispersal by wind and animals. Hedysarum malacophyllum plays a role in soil stabilization and provides nectar for pollinators.
